recipes.title: Daisy Potato Skins

instructions.text: Lightly grease outside of potatoes. Cut a small slit in top and bake at 425°F for 45 minutes. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out cooked potato, leaving a very thin layer of potato interior. (Save cooked potato for mashed potatoes or hash browns.) Brush outside and inside of skins with melted butter. Sprinkle inside with steak seasoning and Parmesan cheese melted. Place on bubbly greased baking sheet. Bake 8 minutes or until crisp and bubbly.

Let stand until cool enough to handle, and scoop out cooked potato, leaving a thin layer. Brush outside and inside of skins with butter. Bake 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top each with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with chives.

notes: Save cooked potato for mashed potatoes or hash browns.
Brush inside and outside of skins with steak seasoning and Parmesan.

recipes.title: Warm and Creamy Bacon Dip

instructions.text: Bring cream cheese to room temperature. Preheat oven to 400°F. In a bowl, combine all ingredients. Place in 1-quart baking dish. Cover.
Heat 25-30 minutes or until hot. Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips. Makes 3 cups.

notes: Serving option: Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.
Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.
Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips.

recipes.title: Bhel Puri
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Chaat Feature
recipes.description: Look for puffed rice and sev at Indian markets; you can substitute chow mein noodles for sev. Find chutneys on the supermarket's international aisle.

instructions.text: Place potato in a medium saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil; cook 8 minutes or until tender. Drain; cool.
Combine potato and remaining ingredients in a large bowl; toss well. Serve immediately. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: about 1 cup).

notes: CALORIES 163; FAT 1.3g (sat 0.2g, mono 0.3g, poly 0.1g); PROTEIN 3.9g; CARB 34g; FIBER 2g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 10mg; SODIUM 210mg; CALC 22mg

recipes.title: Pepper Pancakes with Fresh Cilantro Chutney
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Chaat Feature
recipes.servings_yield: 6 servings (serving size: 1 pancake, about 2 teaspoons chutney, and 1 tablespoon yogurt)
recipes.description: Indian street food—a variety of small snack plates—often defined by a balance of spicy and acidic, salty and sweet, and soft salt and crunchy components. The idea of small plates featuring the vibrant tastes of northern and western India is starting to take hold in this country.

instructions.text: Place first 7 ingredients in a food processor; pulse 4 times or until chopped.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add bell pepper and 1/4 cup onion; cook 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add serrano; cook 1 minute. Place bell pepper mixture in a large bowl. Weigh or lightly spoon flours into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Add flours, salt, cumin, and fennel seeds to bell pepper mixture. Stir in 1 cup water, and let stand 3 minutes.

Heat 1/4 teaspoon oil in pan over medium heat. Pour 1/3 cup batter per pancake into pan; spread batter into 2 (5-inch) circles. Cook 2 minutes or until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked. Flip pancakes; cook 2 minutes or until bottoms are lightly browned. Repeat procedure twice with remaining oil and batter. Serve with chutney and yogurt. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: 1 pancake, about 2 teaspoons chutney, and 1 tablespoon yogurt).

notes: CALORIES 134; FAT 3.1g (sat 0.2g, mono 1.2g, poly 0.6g); PROTEIN 4.8g; CARB 17.5g; FIBER 1.7g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 1.3mg; SODIUM 309mg; CALC 49mg

recipes.title: Lemony Hummus with Spicy Whole-Wheat Pita Chips
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Lunch Feature
recipes.servings_yield: 8 servings (serving size: 3 1/2 tablespoons hummus and 6 chips)
recipes.description: This dish makes a wholesome accompaniment for sandwiches and salads. Keep extra pita chips stored in an airtight container for up to three days.

ingredients.item: can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained
mini whole-wheat pitas, split in half horizontally

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°.
To prepare hummus, combine first 8 ingredients in a food processor; process until smooth.

To prepare chips, combine 2 teaspoons cumin and next 3 ingredients (through red pepper). Cut each pita half into 4 wedges. Arrange pita wedges on a baking sheet. Lightly coat pita with cooking spray. Sprinkle cumin mixture evenly over pita. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until crisp. Serve with hummus. Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 3 1/2 tablespoons hummus and 6 chips).

notes: CALORIES 132; FAT 4g (sat 0.5g, mono 1.8g, poly 1.3g); PROTEIN 4.9g; CARB 20.9g; FIBER 3.4g; CHOL 0mg; IRON 1.5mg; SODIUM 345mg; CALC 38mg

instructions.text: Combine sauces in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring until smooth. Add meatballs. Cover and cook for 15 minutes or until meatballs are heated through, stirring occasionally.
Combine the robust taste of Heinz Chili Sauce and the tangy taste of Ocean Spray Jellied Cranberry Sauce for a uniquely satisfying flavor guaranteed to be a hit!
Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine chili sauce and cranberry sauce in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat, whisking occasionally, until smooth. Reserve one-third of sauce mixture.

Arrange drummettes on baking sheet coated with non-stick spray. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn drummettes over. Brush with remaining sauce mixture until well coated. Bake for additional 20 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with reserved sauce for dipping. Makes 24 appetizers.

recipes.title: Greek Layered Dip with Pita Chips

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°. Line 1 or 2 baking sheets with foil. Cut the pita rounds into eighths. Split each piece in two and place on the prepared baking sheet(s), with the inside of the bread facing up. Spray with the olive oil cooking spray and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of the Greek seasoning. Bake 7 to 10 minutes, or until golden.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, brown the ground lamb with the garlic salt and the remaining 2 teaspoons Greek seasoning. Drain and set aside.

In a shallow 1½-quart dish, spread the hummus on the bottom. Top with a layer of ground lamb, then the tzatziki. Layer with the lettuce, tomatoes, onion, olives and feta. Serve the dip at room temperature with pita chips.

recipes.title: Salmon Sushi Bites
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010 - Sandra Lee Recipe

instructions.text: In a small saucepan over high heat, bring the rice and 1½ cups water to a boil. Reduce the heat; cover and simmer 5 minutes, or until all of the water is absorbed. Stir in the vinegar, sugar, all-purpose seasoning and salt.

On a cutting board, separate the salmon slices and cut into 1½-inch-wide strips. Place 2 teaspoons of the rice at one end of each salmon strip and roll up tightly. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired. Serve the sushi bites with the soy sauce for dipping.
Prepare the pie dough according to the package directions for a double-crust pie. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill.

Preheat the oven to 400°. In a medium saucepan, combine the chicken, salsa and olives. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese. Cool slightly.

On a flour-dusted surface, roll out the dough to ¼ inch thick. Using a 3-inch-round cutter, cut out 36 circles, rerolling the scraps as needed. Place about 1 tablespoon chicken mixture in the center of each circle. Moisten the edges with water. Fold the circles in half and pinch to seal. Pierce the tops with a fork.
Place the empanadas on a baking sheet and bake 15 minutes, or until golden. Serve hot.
Preheat the oven to 400°. Lightly brush 1 side of each baguette slice with olive oil. Place the slices on a baking sheet and toast 5 to 7 minutes, or just until beginning to brown. Let cool.

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and gorgonzola cheese, stirring until well mixed. Spread the toasts with the cheese mixture. Top with the pear slices and chopped candied pecans. Sprinkle with the parsley.
Coarsely grind the fennel seeds, peppercorns and coriander seeds in a spice grinder or with a mortar and pestle. Transfer to a bowl and mix with the salt, sugar and grapefruit zest and juice.

Place the salmon fillets side by side, skin-side down, on a large piece of plastic wrap. Scatter the salt mixture over and around the fish. Top one fillet with the dill, then put the other fillet on top, skin-side up. Pat any extra salt mixture all over the fish. Wrap tightly in the plastic wrap and put the fish on a plate. Cover with another plate and put 2 or 3 heavy cans on top to weigh it down. Refrigerate 2 to 3 days, flipping the salmon daily.
Unwrap the salmon and rinse under cold water to remove the spices and herbs. Pat dry with paper towels. Slice the salmon at an angle as thinly as possible with a sharp knife.

Before serving, press the egg whites through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl. Repeat with the yolks. Arrange the salmon and bread on a platter. Put the chopped onion, chives, capers, beet horseradish and radishes in separate bowls for toppings.
Put 12 halved baby red potatoes in a saucepan and cover with salted water. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook until fork-tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain, then rinse under cold water.
Trim the bottoms of the potatoes and stand cut-side up on a platter; season with sea salt. Top with crème fraîche and chopped chives, dill and/or parsley.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from appetizers category

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs

ingredients.item: fresh pickled cucumber slices, for serving

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, season with salt and cook until golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes; set aside.

Combine ½ cup breadcrumbs and the milk in a bowl; set aside until the milk is absorbed, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir the sherry and mustard powder in a large bowl until dissolved, then beat in 1 egg. Add the soaked breadcrumbs, the browned onion, the pork, turkey, honey, allspice, 2 teaspoons salt, and pepper to taste. Gently mix with your hands until combined.

Dampen your hands; form the mixture into 36 small meatballs, about 1 tablespoon each. Put on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.

Put the remaining 1 cup breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Whisk the remaining 2 eggs and 2 tablespoons water in a bowl. Dip each meatball in egg, letting the excess drip off, then roll in the breadcrumbs; return to the baking sheet.

Heat about 1½ inches vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 325°. Working in batches, fry the meatballs, gently stirring with a slotted spoon, until golden and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and season with salt. Let stand 10 minutes.
Fold the lingonberry preserves into the sour cream and top with the dill. Skewer each meatball with a pickled cucumber slice and serve with the lingonberry cream.

notes: After you shape and bread the meatballs, you can freeze them for up to 2 weeks. To cook, fry for 5 to 6 minutes (do not thaw).
Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Let stand 10 minutes after frying.

instructions.text: Bring cream cheese to room temperature. Preheat oven to 400°F. In a bowl, combine all ingredients. Place in 1-quart baking dish. Cover. Heat 25-30 minutes or until hot. Serve with sliced French bread, crackers and/or chips. Makes 3 cups.
Serving option: Dip may also be placed in hollowed round sourdough loaf, wrapped in foil and heated in 400°F oven for 30 minutes.

Mix 3 tablespoons melted butter with a pinch of salt and cayenne. Lay out rounds of refrigerated biscuit dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Brush with the butter; top with shredded cheddar and chopped chives. Fold into half-moons and crimp to seal, then bake as the label directs. Brush with more butter.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from appetizers category

ingredients.item: sour cream, plus more for serving
frozen artichoke hearts, thawed, squeezed dry and roughly chopped
tortilla chips and salsa, for serving

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Stir in the spinach and cook until bright green, about 30 seconds. Drain and rinse under cold water; squeeze out the excess moisture, then finely chop.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic and ½ teaspoon salt and cook until the onion is soft, about 2 minutes. Add the flour and cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Whisk in the milk and cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, parmesan and sour cream.
Return the pot to medium heat. Add the spinach, cheddar and artichokes and stir until the cheese melts and the dip is heated through. Serve warm with tortilla chips, salsa and sour cream.

recipes.title: Pepperoni Roll-Ups
recipes.description: Easy pizza-style appetizers with crescent rolls, pepperoni, and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F.
Unroll the crescent rolls and separate them into 8 triangles.
Place 5 pepperonis and one string cheese half on the large end of the crescent roll.
Roll up the crescent rolls and sprinkle each of them with garlic powder.
Place the rolls on a greased baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve with warm marinara sauce.

notes: Serve with warm marinara sauce.

recipes.title: Asian Meatballs
recipes.description: Baked meatballs with hoisin glaze and sesame seeds.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F.
Grease a large baking sheet.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, sesame oil, Panko crumbs, 1/2 tsp ground ginger, 2 eggs, 3 tsp minced garlic, and green onions.
Shape this mixture into 1-2 inch balls, the size depending on your preference.
Place the balls on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes or until no longer pink on the inside.
While the meatballs are baking, mix together the hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and ground ginger.
When the meatballs are finished baking, dip each one in the sauce and place on a serving dish.
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the meatballs.

recipes.title: Labneh (Lebanese Cream Cheese)
recipes.description: Traditional Lebanese strained yogurt cheese, simple to make with just yogurt, salt, and olive oil.

instructions.text: To make this recipe we will first need two things: some cheesecloth for lining a container (preferably a bowl) and a container. So grab these two things.
Now get your yogurt and put it into the cheesecloth lined dish. Also put in your salt with the yogurt.
Now grab a colander and put it in the sink or into the dish to catch anything that drains off from the mixture.
Allow everything to drain for at least twenty four hours ideally. What is left over from draining is our cheese.
Take the remaining contents and put them in another dish suitable for storage.
Combine with the cheese, some olive oil, making sure to mix it in well.
Make sure to put a lid on this container and keep it in the fridge.
Enjoy.

notes: Allow everything to drain for at least twenty four hours ideally.
Make sure to put a lid on this container and keep it in the fridge.

recipes.title: Muhammara
recipes.description: A Lebanese walnut and pomegranate dip with warm spices - perfect with pita.

instructions.text: Add all ingredients to food processor and blend until smooth.
Serve with pita pieces.

recipes.title: Avocado Salsa
recipes.description: This avocado salsa is smooth, cool and downright refreshing. Scoop it with chips, spoon it over chicken or steak

ingredients.item: 2 cans (2-1/4 ounces each) sliced ripe olives, drained

instructions.text: Combine the corn, olives, red pepper and onion. In another bowl, mix the next seven ingredients, then pour the combination over the corn mixture, tossing to coat. Refrigerate, covered, overnight.
Just before serving, chop avocados and stir gently into the salsa. Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: California Roll
recipes.description: Making your own California sushi roll is surprisingly easy. You'll need a bamboo mat, sushi rice and nori sheets to get started, and with a bit of practice, you'll be a pro in no time.

ingredients.item: 2 cups sushi rice, rinsed and drained
1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and julienned
Optional: Reduced-sodium soy sauce, prepared wasabi and pickled ginger slices

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, combine the rice and water, and let it stand for 30 minutes. This gives the rice enough time to absorb water and cook more uniformly. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low; cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Remove from the heat, and let the rice stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Editor's Tip: Before beginning this step, be sure to wash your rice thoroughly.
Meanwhile, in small bowl, combine the vinegar, sugar and salt, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. You'll use this mixture to season the rice.

Transfer the rice to a large shallow bowl, and drizzle with the vinegar mixture. With a wooden paddle or spoon, stir the rice with a slicing motion to cool it slightly. Cover the rice with a damp cloth to keep it from drying out. Editor's Tip: This rice mixture may be made up to two hours ahead and stored at room temperature, covered with a damp towel. Do not refrigerate or it will ruin the texture of the sushi rice.

Sprinkle toasted and black sesame seeds onto a plate, and set it aside. Place your sushi mat on a work surface so the mat rolls away from you; line the mat with plastic wrap. Place 3/4 cup rice on plastic. With moistened fingers, press the rice into an 8-inch square. It's OK to see a few tiny holes in the square. The rice will get pressed together when you roll. Top the rice square with one nori sheet. Editor's Tip: The nori has a smooth side and a rough side, which you can feel if you drag a finger across the sheet. Lay the nori on the rice with the rough side facing you and the smooth side pressed into the rice.

Arrange a small amount of cucumber, crab and avocado about 1-1/2 inches from bottom edge of the nori sheet. (Less is more here. You don't want to overstuff the roll or it won't roll into perfect pinwheels in the end.) Using your bamboo mat, roll up the rice mixture over the filling. The mat can lift and compress the mixture while rolling, bringing one side of the rice square to the other and pinching it closed along the seam. Remove the plastic wrap as you roll. You'll keep this sheet over the sushi so it doesn't dry out while you make more rolls.

Remove the mat from your work station, and roll the sushi roll in the sesame seeds. Cover with the plastic wrap. Repeat these steps with the remaining ingredients to make eight rolls. Cut each roll into eight pieces. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi and ginger slices if desired.

recipes.title: Cashew Cheese
recipes.description: There are few food situations this vegan cashew cheese can't elevate. It's easy to make and ready to be spread on crackers or transformed into mac and cheese.

instructions.text: Place the cashews in a small bowl and add enough warm water to cover them completely. Soak the cashews for one to two hours; drain and discard the water. Editor's Tip: You can soak your cashews for as long as overnight.

Add the cashews and the remaining five ingredients to your food processor. Cover and process until smooth, one to two minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally. Transfer the cheese to a serving dish. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Editor's Tip: You can also make this in a blender, although we find it more effective in a food processor due to the amount of liquid used.

recipes.title: Garlic Bean Dip
recipes.description: There isn't a bean that my family does not like. In fact, I serve one kind or another almost every day. This dip is one of our favorite ways to eat them.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
Baked pita chips or assorted fresh vegetables

instructions.text: Place first 5 ingredients in a food processor; process until almost smooth. Add mayonnaise and parsley; pulse just until blended. Serve with pita chips or vegetables.

recipes.title: Orange Shrimp Mojo
recipes.description: With jalapeno, orange and avocado, this enticing entree is spicy, tangy and fresh with every bite. The sauce beautifully glazes the shrimp.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon grated orange or tangerine zest
1 pound uncooked jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 large navel orange, peeled, sectioned and chopped

instructions.text: In a small dry skillet over medium heat, toast cumin seeds and peppercorns until aromatic, 1-2 minutes. Remove from skillet. Crush seeds using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
In a small bowl, combine orange zest, oregano, salt and crushed spices. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon spice mixture over shrimp.

In a large skillet, cook shrimp in oil over medium-high heat 1 minute; turn shrimp. Add orange juice, rum, garlic and 1 tablespoon spice mixture. Cook and stir until shrimp turn pink, 1-2 minutes longer; remove and keep warm.

Bring liquid in skillet to a boil. Cook until reduced to 2/3 cup, about 35 minutes. Meanwhile, for salsa, combine orange, onion, avocado, 1/4 cup cilantro, jalapeno and the remaining spice mixture in a small bowl.
Stir shrimp and remaining cilantro into sauce; heat through. Serve with salsa.

recipes.title: Sweet Pea Pesto
recipes.description: I made a healthier spin on pea pesto by subbing in vegetable broth for some of the oil and going easy on the cheese. For use on pasta, add more broth for a saucelike consistency.

ingredients.item: 12 ounces fresh or frozen peas, thawed
1 whole wheat French bread demi-baguette (about 6 ounces and 12 in. long)
2 cups cherry tomatoes (about 10 ounces), halved or quartered

instructions.text: Preheat broiler. Place peas, garlic, vinegar, salt and lemon pepper in a blender or food processor; pulse until well blended. Continue processing while gradually adding oil in a steady stream. Add cheese; pulse just until blended. Add broth; pulse until mixture reaches desired consistency.
Cut baguette into 20 slices, each 1/2 in. thick. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Broil 4-5 in. from heat until golden brown, 45-60 seconds per side. Remove to wire rack to cool.
To assemble crostini, spread each slice with about 1 tablespoon pesto mixture; top with tomato pieces.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Eggplant
recipes.description: Air-fryer eggplant fries coated in savory breading and Parmesan cheese totally make us forget about classic potato fries. They work well as a side dish or an anytime snack.

instructions.text: Preheat your air fryer to 375°F. While it preheats, whisk eggs in a shallow bowl (or any dish that makes dipping easy). In another shallow bowl, combine the cheese, wheat germ, Italian seasonings and garlic salt.

Trim the ends of the eggplant. Cut the eggplant lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Cut the slices lengthwise into 1/2-inch strips. Once you have the right fry shape, dip them into the eggs, and then roll them in the cheese mixture to coat all sides. Editor's Tip: Be careful and consistent when cutting your fry shapes. Too thin and they might cook up too crispy; too thick and they might not cook all the way through.

Working in batches, arrange the eggplant fries in a single layer on a greased tray in your air-fryer basket. Spritz the tops of the air-fryer eggplant fries with cooking spray, and cook for four to five minutes or until golden brown. Turn the eggplant fries, spritz again, and cook them for another four to five minutes or until golden brown.
Serve the fries immediately with pasta sauce on the side.

recipes.title: Apple-Nut Blue Cheese Tartlets
recipes.description: These tasty appetizers look and taste gourmet, but they're easy to make and have loads of blue cheese flavor. The phyllo shells and filling can be made in advance

ingredients.item: 1 large apple, peeled and finely chopped
4 tablespoons finely chopped walnuts, toasted, divided
1 package (1.9 ounces) frozen miniature phyllo tart shells

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. In a small nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add apple and onion; cook and stir 3-5 minutes or until tender. Remove from the heat; stir in blue cheese, 3 tablespoons walnuts and salt. Spoon a rounded tablespoon of mixture into each tart shell.
Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts; bake until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes longer.
Freeze option: Freeze cooled pastries in a freezer container, separating layers with waxed paper. To use, reheat pastries on a baking sheet in a preheated 350° oven until crisp and heated through.

recipes.title: Avocado Endive Cups with Salsa
recipes.description: I jazz up guacamole by serving it atop endive leaves. Add a brilliant red pepper salsa, and you’ve got a standout appetizer.

ingredients.item: 1 jar (12 ounces) roasted sweet red peppers, drained and finely chopped
1/4 cup sliced ripe olives, finely chopped
2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and pitted

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine red peppers, fennel, olives, oil and cilantro; stir in 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper.
In another bowl, mash avocados with a fork. Stir in lime juice, jalapeno, green onion, garlic, cumin, pepper sauce and the remaining salt and pepper. Stir in tomatoes.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon avocado mixture onto each endive leaf; top each with about 1 tablespoon pepper mixture. Sprinkle with fennel fronds.

recipes.title: Baked Pot Stickers with Dipping Sauce
recipes.description: Twisting these wonton wrappers like little candies makes them fuss-free, and the dipping sauce is packed with sweet heat.

ingredients.item: 2 cups finely chopped cooked chicken breast
1 can (8 ounces) water chestnuts, drained and chopped

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°. In a large bowl, combine the first 9 ingredients. Place 2 teaspoons of filling in center of a wonton wrapper. (Cover rest of wrappers with a damp paper towel until ready to use.)
Moisten wrapper edges with water. Fold edge over filling and roll to form a log; twist ends to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
Place pot stickers on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray; spritz each with cooking spray. Bake 12-15 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Meanwhile, place jelly in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave, covered, on high until melted. Stir in vinegar and soy sauce. Serve sauce with pot stickers.

recipes.title: Baked Veggie Cups
recipes.description: These colorful veggie cups are not only tasty, but they also pack in a surprising amount of nutrition! The addition of mozzarella and Parmesan is the perfect Italian touch.

ingredients.item: 1 medium sweet red pepper, finely chopped
1/4 cup reduced-fat sun-dried tomato salad dressing
10 flavored tortillas of your choice (10 inches)

instructions.text: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook and stir the eggplant, onion, red pepper, zucchini and garlic in salad dressing for 3 minutes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from the heat; stir in tomato and Parmesan cheese.

With a 3-in. biscuit cutter, cut 48 circles from tortillas. Cut a slit halfway into each tortilla circle. Shape into a cone; place in a miniature muffin cup. Spoon 4 teaspoons vegetable mixture into each cup. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Bake at 350° for 5-7 minutes or until tortilla cups are crisp and cheese is melted. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Balsamic-Goat Cheese Grilled Plums
recipes.description: Make a bold statement with this simple yet elegant treat. Ripe plums are grilled and then dressed with a balsamic reduction and tangy goat cheese.

ingredients.item: 4 medium firm plums, halved and pitted

instructions.text: For glaze, in a small saucepan, combine vinegar and lemon zest; bring to a boil. Cook 10-12 minutes or until mixture is thickened and reduced to about 1/3 cup (do not overcook).
Grill plums, covered, over medium heat 2-3 minutes on each side or until tender. Drizzle with glaze; top with cheese.

recipes.title: White Bean Hummus
recipes.description: All it takes is a handful of ingredients and a few minutes to pull together this creamy white bean hummus recipe.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.text: Place the garlic in the bowl of a food processor. Cover and process until minced. Editor's Tip: A food processor is a handy kitchen gadget for making easy work of chopping, slicing, shredding and pureeing ingredients. It really does make the best hummus. These are our Test Kitchen's picks for best food processors.
Add the drained beans, tahini, lemon juice, cumin, salt and pepper flakes. Cover and process until smooth.
Transfer the hummus to a small bowl and stir in the parsley. Refrigerate until serving.

recipes.title: Caprese Skewers
recipes.description: Light, satisfying and healthful in one impossibly easy-to-make dish? Yes, please! Enjoy these Caprese skewers as an app, side dish

instructions.text: On each skewer, thread a grape tomato, a basil leaf, a mozzarella ball, then another basil leaf, and finally the second grape tomato. Place the loaded skewers on a platter as you go. Editor's Tip: If you have extra ingredients, feel free to thread the skewers differently.
In a small bowl, whisk the olive oil and vinegar to make a quick vinaigrette. Lightly drizzle it over the skewers. They're ready to serve!

recipes.title: Roasted Chickpeas
recipes.description: Crispy chickpeas will become a favorite when you need something crunchy on your salads and bowls. An added bonus? They're vegan!

ingredients.item: 2 cans (15 ounces each) chickpeas or garbanzo beans, rinsed, drained and patted dry

instructions.text: Line a 15x10x1-inch baking sheet with foil. Spread the chickpeas in a single layer over the foil, removing any loose skins.
Bake the chickpeas at 400ºF for 40 to 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes or so. When fully baked, they'll be crunchy.
Meanwhile, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil, chili powder, ground cumin, grated lime zest, lime juice and sea salt.
Remove the chickpeas from the oven and let them cool for 5 minutes. Drizzle them with the oil mixture and shake the pan to coat. Cool completely.

recipes.title: Cilantro & Lime Chicken with Scoops
recipes.description: I came up with this recipe when I was preparing for a large party and wanted a healthy Tex-Mex chicken to serve in tortilla chip cups. You can make this party dish ahead of time to free yourself for time-sensitive dishes. Serve it in tortilla cups or any other savory, crispy cup you like. Enjoy the leftovers over salad greens or wrapped up in tender tortillas for burritos.

ingredients.item: 1 medium sweet red pepper, finely chopped

instructions.text: Place chicken in a 1-1/2-qt. slow cooker; sprinkle with chili powder and lime juice. Cook, covered, on low 3-4 hours or until tender.
Remove chicken; discard cooking juices. Shred chicken with 2 forks; return to slow cooker. Add corn and salsa; cook, covered, on low 30 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a large bowl if desired. Stir in cheese, pepper and green onions. Sprinkle with cilantro; serve with tortilla scoops.

recipes.title: Texas Caviar
recipes.description: This top-rated recipe for Texas caviar is a guaranteed favorite at any tailgate or potluck. The fresh dip is made from black-eyed peas, corn, tomatoes and avocado, all tossed in a zippy vinaigrette and served with crispy tortilla chips.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (15-1/2 ounces each) black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes and green chiles, drained
1 cup fresh whole kernel corn or frozen shoepeg corn, thawed
1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the peas, tomatoes, green pepper, corn and onion.
In a small bowl, whisk the dressing, lime juice, salt and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the black-eyed pea mixture and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Stir in avocado just before serving. Serve with chips. Editor's Tip: Adding the avocado at the last minute prevents it from getting mushy and discolored.

recipes.title: Corn Salsa
recipes.description: This simple corn salsa is a celebration of summer produce.

ingredients.item: 2 medium ears sweet corn in husks
1 tablespoon finely chopped sweet red pepper

instructions.text: Peel back husks of corn, but don't remove them. Remove the silk and replace the husks, tying them closed with kitchen twine. Place the corn in a bowl, cover with water and soak for 20 minutes. Editor's Tip: The husks play an important role in preserving moisture in the corn, so don't peel them away completely. They're also important to keep on when storing corn on the cob, so don't shuck them until you're ready to enjoy the corn.

Drain. Grill the corn in their husks, covered, over medium-high heat for 20 to 35 minutes or until husks are blackened and corn is tender. Turn several times for even cooking. Cool. Editor's Tip: Don't miss our guide on how to grill corn for more helpful tips.
Remove corn from cobs and place in a serving bowl. Editor's Tip: Here's how to cut corn from the cob the right way. (It's also the easy way.)
Add the tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, peppers, salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then serve the corn salsa with tortilla chips or a top-rated Mexican recipe.

recipes.title: Curried Chicken Meatball Wraps
recipes.description: My strategy to get picky kids to eat healthy: Letting everyone assemble their dinner at the table. We love these easy meatball wraps, topped with crunchy veggies and peanuts, sweet raisins, and a creamy dollop of yogurt.

ingredients.item: 24 small Bibb or Boston lettuce leaves

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. In a large bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. Add chicken; mix lightly but thoroughly. With wet hands, shape mixture into 24 balls (about 1-1/4-in.).
Place meatballs on a greased rack in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Bake 17-20 minutes or until cooked through.
In a small bowl, mix sauce ingredients. To serve, place 2 teaspoons sauce and 1 meatball in each lettuce leaf; top with remaining ingredients.

recipes.title: Four-Tomato Salsa
recipes.description: The variety of tomatoes, onions and peppers makes this chunky salsa so good. Whenever I try to take a batch to a get-together, it's hard to keep my family from finishing it off first! It's a super snack with tortilla chips or as a relish with meat.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup each chopped green, sweet red, orange and yellow pepper
1/3 cup mild pickled pepper rings, chopped

instructions.text: In a colander, combine tomatoes and salt. Let drain for 10 minutes.
Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in lime juice, oil, onions, peppers, pepperoncini, pepper rings, parsley, cilantro and chervil. Serve with tortilla chips. Refrigerate leftovers for up to 1 week.

recipes.title: Fresh from the Garden Wraps
recipes.description: We moved into a house with a garden that needed tending. Using the herbs we found, we made these fresh-tastic wraps for our first dinner there.

instructions.text: Cut corn from cob and place in a large bowl. Add cucumber, cabbage, tomato, onion, jalapeno and herbs.
Whisk together chili sauce, vinegar, soy sauce and peanut butter. Pour over vegetable mixture; toss to coat. Let stand 20 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, place 1/2 cup mixture in each lettuce leaf. Fold lettuce over filling.

recipes.title: Makeover Creamy Artichoke Dip
recipes.description: Folks are sure to gather around this ooey-gooey, lightened-up dip whenever it's placed on any buffet table. With cheese, jalapenos and a hint of lemon, it's a treasured favorite.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14 ounces each) water-packed artichoke hearts, rinsed, drained and coarsely chopped
1 package (8 ounces) reduced-fat cream cheese, cubed

instructions.text: In a 3-qt. slow cooker, combine the artichokes, cream cheese, yogurt, mozzarella cheese, ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, Swiss cheese, mayonnaise, lemon juice, jalapeno, garlic powder and seasoned salt. Cover and cook on low for 1 hour or until heated through.
Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese. Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Peachy Jalapeno Guacamole
recipes.description: Fresh jalapenos and summer-ripe peaches give this creamy guacamole so much flavor. It's got a little kick, but I love that it's not so spicy it burns off my taste buds!

ingredients.item: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
1 medium peach, peeled and finely chopped

instructions.text: Mash avocados with lime juice, salt, cumin and pepper. Gently stir in peach, jalapeno and red onion. Serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Pork Satay
recipes.description: This easy pork satay recipe combines savory, sweet and spiced flavors with a rich peanut sauce. Whether you’re hosting or craving something special, this dish is sure to impress.

ingredients.item: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into 1/4-inch slices

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, green onions, brown sugar, cilantro, Thai chili sauce, sesame oil and garlic. Mix until the brown sugar dissolves. Set aside 1/4 cup for the dipping sauce and pour the rest of the sauce into a bowl or shallow dish. Add the pork and turn to fully coat each piece. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight for a more intense flavor.

Drain the pork. Then thread the marinated pork slices onto 20 metal or soaked wooden skewers. Discard the marinade and place the skewers in a greased baking pan. Broil for three to four minutes on each side. Editor's Tip: Soak the wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes before broiling to prevent burning.
Combine peanut butter and water in a small bowl until smooth. Stir in the lime juice and the reserved soy sauce mixture. Use a blender to mix the ingredients for a smoother peanut sauce.

recipes.title: Beet Hummus
recipes.description: Break out of the plain hummus rut with this beet hummus recipe. Earthy, sweet beets are a vibrant, wholesome addition to the classic dip.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon plus 1/4 cup olive oil, divided
1 can (15 ounces) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
Minced fresh dill weed or parsley

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Pierce the beets with a fork or sharp knife. Place the beets in a microwave-safe bowl, and cover loosely with paper towels. Microwave the beets on high for four minutes, stirring halfway to ensure they cook evenly. Allow to cool slightly, then wrap each beet in foil as individual packets.

Remove the papery outer skin from the garlic bulb, but do not peel or separate the cloves. Cut the bulb in half crosswise. Sprinkle the halves with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and drizzle with 1 teaspoon oil. Wrap each half in individual foil packets. Roast the beets and garlic until the garlic cloves are soft and can be easily pierced with a knife, about 45 minutes.

Remove the roasted vegetables from the oven. Carefully unwrap from the foil. Rinse the beets with cold water until you can safely handle them, then peel them. Place the beets in a food processor. Squeeze the garlic cloves from their skins, and add them to the food processor. Add the garbanzo beans, lemon juice, tahini, cumin, cayenne pepper and remaining oil, salt and pepper. Process until smooth.

If desired, pulse 2 tablespoons Greek yogurt into the beet hummus. Scrape the hummus into a serving bowl. If desired, dollop the remaining yogurt over the top. Sprinkle with dill or parsley. Serve with assorted vegetables, crackers or pita bread.

recipes.title: Red Pepper Tapenade
recipes.description: This roasted red pepper tapenade combines sweet red peppers, almonds and basil into a delicious spread that's perfect for entertaining or everyday snacking. Serve it with toasted baguette slices or water crackers.

ingredients.item: 2 cups roasted sweet red peppers, drained
Toasted French bread baguette slices or water crackers

instructions.text: In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the peeled garlic cloves and cook, uncovered, just until tender, six to eight minutes. Drain and pat the garlic dry.

In a small food processor, combine the blanched garlic, red peppers, almonds, tomato paste, oil, salt and pepper. Process until blended. Editor's Tip: The roasted pepper tapenade should have a smooth, thick consistency.

Transfer the tapenade to a small bowl and refrigerate it for at least four hours to allow the flavors to meld. When ready to serve, sprinkle it with basil and serve it with baguette slices. Editor's Tip: You can serve the tapenade chilled or take it out of the fridge 30 minutes before serving to let it come to room temperature.

recipes.title: Skinny Quinoa Veggie Dip
recipes.description: Don’t let the name fool you. This good-for-you recipe may appeal to an athlete in training, but it has plenty of flavor to satisfy everyone. We use crunchy cucumber slices for dippers.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and coarsely chopped
2 tablespoons plus 3/4 cup sour cream, divided
3/4 cup peeled, seeded and finely chopped cucumber

instructions.text: Pulse beans, cumin, paprika, cayenne and 1/3 cup water in food processor until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste.

In a small saucepan, cook quinoa with remaining 1-1/3 cups water according to package directions. Fluff with fork; sprinkle with 2 tablespoons lime juice. Set aside. Meanwhile, mash together avocados, 2 tablespoons sour cream, cilantro and remaining lime juice.

In a 2-1/2-qt. dish, layer bean mixture, quinoa, avocado mixture, remaining sour cream, tomatoes, chopped cucumber, zucchini and onion. Serve immediately with cucumber slices for dipping, or refrigerate.

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon New Potatoes
recipes.description: Give twice-baked potatoes a rest this year and try these stuffed spuds. Smoked salmon and cream cheese blended with lemon juice and dill are simply piped into small red potatoes. Leftovers are even good with eggs for breakfast.

ingredients.item: 36 baby red potatoes (1-1/2 inches wide, about 1-1/2 pounds)
1 package (8 ounces) reduced-fat cream cheese, cubed
2 packages (3 ounces each) smoked salmon or lox
2 tablespoons snipped fresh dill or 2 teaspoons dill weed

instructions.text: Place potatoes in a large saucepan; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cook, covered, until tender, 15-20 minutes. Drain potatoes; immediately drop in ice water. Drain; pat dry.
Cut a thin slice off the bottom of each potato to allow them to lie flat. Using a melon baller, remove a small portion from the top of each potato.

For filling, place all remaining ingredients except dill sprigs in a food processor; process until smooth. To serve, pipe or spoon about 2 teaspoons filling into each potato. Top with dill sprigs. Refrigerate leftovers.

recipes.title: Spicy Shrimp Salsa
recipes.description: Radishes add a wonderful crunch to this colorful salsa that is also superb over grilled fish. There's just enough jalapeno to give flavor without much of the heat.

ingredients.item: 1/2 pound cooked shrimp, peeled, deveined and chopped
1-1/2 teaspoons finely chopped seeded jalapeno pepper

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients. Refrigerate until serving. Serve with chips.

recipes.title: Tangy Texas Salsa
recipes.description: I'm a "transplant" from Wisconsin currently living in Texas. Even after 20 years, I can't get enough of our wonderful local citrus. This is one way to work it into a main dish. The combination of tangy fruit, spicy jalapeno and distinctive cilantro is perfect over any meat, poultry or fish. We also dip into it with chips.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine first nine ingredients.

Cut a thin slice off top and bottom of grapefruit and orange; stand upright on a cutting board. With a knife, cut off peel and outer membrane of fruit. Cut along the membrane of each segment to remove fruit; add to pepper mixture.
Stir gently to combine. Refrigerate, covered, at least 2 hours.

recipes.title: Tomato Focaccia
recipes.description: Tomato focaccia bread is a fantastic side for all sorts of dishes, such as roasted chicken, pork chops, sea bass, and more. It's also fantastic on its own or topped with a fried egg.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon each dried oregano, thyme and rosemary, crushed

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil and the salt, sugar, garlic powder, herbs and pepper to the bowl, followed by 1 1/2 cups of flour. Beat until the mixture is smooth, then stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough—the dough will be sticky.

Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, then knead it until it grows smooth and elastic, which will take six to eight minutes. Next, place it in a greased bowl, turning the dough once to grease the top. Cover the bowl and let the bread rise in a warm place until it has doubled, which will take about an hour.

After the hour has passed, punch the dough down, cover it again and let it rest for 10 minutes. Then shape the dough into a 13-by-9-inch rectangle and place it on a greased baking sheet. Cover it and let rise until doubled, which will take about 30 minutes. Then, with your fingertips, make dimples over the top of the dough.

Brush the dough with the remaining oil, then arrange tomatoes over the top. Sprinkle over the cheeses, then bake the focaccia at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes, or until it's golden brown. Remove it to a wire rack to cool, then enjoy.

recipes.title: Vegetable Samosas
recipes.description: My family enjoys the wonderful Indian flavors in a traditional samosa. Baked instead of fried, this version has fewer calories but keeps all the classic tastes and textures we love.

ingredients.item: 1 cup canned garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed, drained and mashed
1 package (16 ounces, 14x9-inch sheet size) frozen phyllo dough, thawed

instructions.text: Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes; set aside.

In a large skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Add the garlic, salt, curry powder, cumin and pepper; cook 1 minute longer. Remove from the heat. Stir in the mashed potatoes, garbanzo beans, peas and cilantro.

Place 1 sheet of phyllo dough on a work surface with a short end facing you. (Keep remaining phyllo covered with a damp towel to prevent it from drying out.) Spray sheet with cooking spray; top with 1 more sheet of phyllo, spray with cooking spray. Cut into two 14x4-1/2-in. strips.

Place 2 tablespoons of filling on lower corner of each strip. Fold dough over filling, forming a triangle. Fold triangle up, then fold triangle over, forming another triangle. Continue folding, like a flag, to the end of the strip.
Spritz end of dough with cooking spray and press onto triangle to seal. Turn triangle and spritz top with spray. Repeat with remaining phyllo and filling.
Place triangles on greased baking sheets. Bake at 375° for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. If desired, serve with mint chutney.

recipes.title: Zippy Shrimp Skewers
recipes.description: These flavorful skewers deliver a mouthwatering kick with minimal effort. Fix them for your next party and watch them disappear.

ingredients.item: 3/4 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

instructions.text: In a large shallow dish, combine the first 7 ingredients; add shrimp. Turn to coat; cover and refrigerate for 2-4 hours.

Drain and discard marinade. Thread shrimp onto 6 metal or soaked wooden skewers. Grill, uncovered, on a lightly oiled rack over medium heat or broil 4 in. from the heat until shrimp turn pink, 2-3 minutes on each side.

recipes.title: Cheesy Bruschetta Dip
recipes.description: This creamy, flavorful dip comes together quickly and is a real crowd-pleaser. It is a delicious complement to a meal or a fun appetizer to serve at a party.

ingredients.item: 8 ounces cream cheese, softened and cubed
1 French bread baguette, sliced and toasted

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. Spread cream cheese and goat cheese into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish. Evenly distribute tomatoes, parmesan, garlic, Italian seasoning, parsley, salt and pepper over top. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar.
Bake until bubbly and browned, 20-25 minutes. Drizzle with olive oil; serve with toasted baguette slices for dipping.

recipes.title: Dirty Martini Dip
recipes.description: You'll find all the iconic ingredients of the namesake cocktail in this dirty martini dip, right down to the vodka, vermouth and olive brine.

ingredients.item: 1/3 cup crumbled blue cheese, plus additional for garnish
1 cup chopped pitted Castelvetrano or pimento-stuffed olives

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, blue cheese, garlic powder, lemon zest, black pepper and hot sauce until they're completely smooth. Editor's Tip: You can use a hand mixer or stand mixer to make this process easier.
Slowly stir in the vodka, olive brine and vermouth. Fold in the chopped olives and minced chives.

Cover the bowl with storage wrap and refrigerate the dip for at least two hours. When you’re ready, remove the wrap and serve the dip with assorted crackers and vegetables. Editor’s Tip: Right after the dip comes together, I like to transfer it to a pretty serving bowl for a cleaner look, then chill the dip until I’m ready to serve it.

recipes.title: Salsa Criolla
recipes.description: If salsa criolla sounds exotic, your ears are not deceiving you. It’s an essential Peruvian salsa that brings acidity and sweetness to sandwiches, meat dishes, potatoes and even eggs. But it’s not for Peruvian cuisine only. Try it on your regular weeknight meals for a little variety.

ingredients.item: 2 medium red onions, very thinly sliced
2 medium sweet orange or yellow peppers, very thinly sliced

instructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the lime juice, oil and salt. Add the red onion, sweet peppers, jalapeno and cilantro. Toss to combine and serve at room temperature. Editor’s Tip: Roll the lime around on a countertop to loosen the fibers and extract more juice. You can also use a fork to break down the pulp and get every last drop out.

recipes.title: Smashed Zucchini Dip
recipes.description: Smashed zucchini dip is a take on the eggplant spread called baba ganoush, but with a different main ingredient. It's the healthy and flavorful party spread you never knew you needed!

ingredients.item: Olive oil and freshly chopped herbs, for garnish

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat, and add the zucchini. Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, depending on the size of the squash, until the zucchini is tender all the way through when pierced. Editor's Tip: If the squash are particularly large, you could cut them short so that the stem is on one piece and the blossom end is on the other.

Place the cooked zucchini in a colander. Let them drain for 30 minutes, until they're cool to the touch, while you prepare the other ingredients. Editor's Tip: Weigh the cooked zucchini down so that the water drains out. I perched a plate on the squash and then put a water-filled, quart-sized glass jar on top of the plate.
Mince or grate the zucchini and place it back in the colander to drain for 10 to 15 additional minutes. Transfer to a large bowl.
Add the salt, lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, grated garlic, tahini and pepper, and stir until combined. Transfer to a serving bowl, and top with fresh herbs and additional olive oil, if desired.

recipes.title: Granny's 7 Layer Dip
recipes.description: Such a special recipe today from Granny! This dip is no-cook, easy to throw together, and so DELICIOUS with chips!

ingredients.item: 1 1/2 cups sour cream or plain Greek yogurt
2 cups mixed, shredded cheddar and pepper jack cheese

instructions.text: 1. In the bottom of a glass serving bowl or Pyrex dish, layer in the following order: refried beans, sour cream/yogurt, guacamole, salsa, half of the cheese, half the cilantro, half the scallions, and the olives. Top with the remaining cheese. 2. Before serving top the dip with the remaining cilantro, scallions, lime juice, and sea salt. Serve with so many tortilla chips!

recipes.title: Avocado Shrimp Salsa
recipes.description: A quick to prepare salsa that's a go-to for entertaining, snacking, and lite meals...perfect for hot days when you don't want to cook!

ingredients.item: 1-2  jalapeños, seeded, if desired, and chopped
1 tablespoon lime zest, plus 1/4 cup lime juice

instructions.text: 1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the shrimp and simmer until pink, about 2-3 minutes depending on size of the shrimp. Drain, then run the shrimp under cold water to stop the cooking. Once cool, give the shrimp a chop.2. Add the chopped shrimp to a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and season with salt. Enjoy with plenty of chips!

recipes.title: One Skillet Cheesy Salsa Chicken Rice Bake
recipes.description: A wonderful dinner that's easily made in one skillet and under an hour...perfect for game night!

ingredients.item: 1 pound chicken breasts or thighs, cut into chunks
1/2 cup dry broken spaghetti or angel hair pasta
1/2 cup shredded pepper jack or spicy cheddar

instructions.text: 1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.2. In a large oven-safe skillet, cook the oil/butter, onion, chicken, bell pepper, oregano, and chipotle chili powder. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes until the chicken is browned. Add the pasta and rice and cook for 1-2 minutes, until lightly toasted and golden. Stir in the salsa. Add 2 cups of water and the pepperoncini. Bring to a boil. Stir in the beans. 3. Place the lid on the skillet and turn the heat down to the lowest setting. Allow the rice to cook for 15 minutes, until most of the liquid has cooked into the rice, but not all of it.3. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the cheese over the chicken/rice. Bake for 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted.4. Serve topped as desired with avocado, cilantro, scallions, and lime. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Mexican Street Corn Dip
recipes.description: All the flavors of street corn mixed into the creamiest corn-filled dip. Quick, easy, and so delicious with tortilla chips on the side!

ingredients.item: 1/2-2 teaspoons cayenne pepper, to your taste
6 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
1/3 cup olive oil mayo (or use plain Greek yogurt)
1 ear grilled corn, kernels removed from the cob

instructions.text: 1. Mix the spices. In a bowl, combine the chili powder, paprika, cayenne, and a pinch of salt. 2. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until soft, 5 minutes. Add the corn, garlic, 1 teaspoon of the spice mix, and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the corn is softened, 5 minutes. 3. Reduce the heat to low. Mix in the cream cheese until melted and creamy. Stir in the sour cream. Cook until warmed throughout. If desired, thin the dip with milk.4. In a separate skillet, melt the butter until golden. Mix in 3 teaspoons of the spice mix, plus a pinch of chili flakes and salt. Cook another minute, then remove from the heat. 5. Mix the mayo and lime juice with a pinch of salt. 6. Spoon the dip into a wide serving bowl. Top with grilled corn and drizzle the mayo and spicy butter over the corn. Sprinkle on the cheese and cilantro. Serve with lots of chips for scooping!

recipes.title: Ceviche
recipes.description: Ceviche made from raw fish or shrimp "cooked" in tangy citrus and mixed with cucumber, red onion, cilantro, jalapeño, avocado, and tomatoes.

ingredients.item: 1 pound medium raw shrimp, (peeled and deveined)
½ cup lemon juice ((about 2 large lemons))
½ cup finely chopped red onion
1  jalapeño pepper, (seeded and deveined, finely chopped)

instructions.text: Dice the raw shrimp into small bite-size pieces and add them into a large non-reactive bowl. Glass or food-grade plastic bowls are both good options.
Add the lemon juice, lime juice, red onion, garlic, and jalapeño to the bowl and lightly toss together with the shrimp to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes until the shrimp is bright pink and opaque.
Add the tomatoes, cucumber, and cilantro to the bowl. Lightly toss to combine, cover, and refrigerate for an additional 10 minutes.
Add in the avocado, salt, and black pepper. Lightly toss to combine, taste, and add more salt as needed. Serve immediately with tostadas or tortilla chips.

recipes.title: Pumpkin and Shrimp Ceviche
recipes.description: I've always loved the freshness of a good shrimp ceviche, and this one doesn't disappoint. The pumpkin replaces the jicama, and it’s just barely cooked to offer a crunchy delight of fall flavor. It will taste best if you allow it to marinate overnight. —Robert Rossi, Independence, Louisiana

ingredients.item: 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
10 uncooked shrimp (26-30 per pound), peeled and deveined
1 cup cubed fresh white or orange pumpkin (1/4-inch cubes)
Optional: Lime wedges and jalapeno slices

instructions.text: Place the first 7 ingredients in a large bowl; toss to combine. Gently stir in avocado; set aside.

In a small saucepan, bring 4 cups water to a boil. Add shrimp; cook, uncovered, just until shrimp turn pink, 2-3 minutes, adding pumpkin during the last 45 seconds of cooking. Drain; rinse with cold water and drain well. Coarsely chop shrimp; stir shrimp and pumpkin into avocado mixture. Refrigerate, covered, until well chilled, at least 2 hours. Serve with saltines and, if desired, lime wedges and jalapeno slices.

recipes.title: Cottage Canape Spread
recipes.source_note: Cottage Cheese Recipe Book - Appetizers, Salads, Salad Dressings, Breads, Main Dishes, Desserts (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Drain excess moisture from cottage cheese and force through fine sieve. Combine with bouillon paste and onion juice and beat vigorously to blend. Chill until ready to use. Use as a spread on crisp wafers.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from appetizers category

recipes.title: Lemon Appetizer
recipes.source_note: Scotts North American Seasonal Cook Book Spring Summer Autumn And Winter Guide To Economy And Ease In Good Food 1921 (PDF cookbook)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe from Scotts North American Seasonal Cook Book Spring Summer Autumn And Winter Guide To Economy And Ease In Good Food 1921

instructions.text: Boilsugar andwater together 10 minutes. Remove from
fireandaddthestrained lemon juiceandgrated rind.When
coldserve overshaved iceandgarnish with candied cherries

recipes.title: Italian Canape
recipes.source_note: Wilsons Cook Book Numerous New Recipes On Present Economic Conditions 1920 (PDF cookbook)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe from Wilsons Cook Book Numerous New Recipes On Present Economic Conditions 1920

instructions.text: Now place four tablespoons ofshortening inasaucepan
andaddthevegetables. Cook slowly until tender andthenadd
Mixthoroughly andthen spread onthin slices oftoast.
Garnish with sliced stuffed olives anddustwithpaprika.
Dissolve theflour inmilkandwater ;bring toaboil ;cook

recipes.title: Labrete Canape
recipes.source_note: Wilsons Cook Book Numerous New Recipes On Present Economic Conditions 1920 (PDF cookbook)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe from Wilsons Cook Book Numerous New Recipes On Present Economic Conditions 1920

instructions.text: Method not fully extracted - see original source.

recipes.title: Conch Fritters: Bahamian Style
recipes.description: A traditional Bahamian recipe made with conch, the wonderful shellfish. These fritters are great as appetizers, finger foods or very tasty hors d'oeuvres. Conch can be replaced with calamari, shrimp, imitation crab meat and lobster. BEWARE - these are HOT!

ingredients.prep_note: or Pickapeppa Sauce, for dipping sauce

instructions.text: Heat the oil in large pot or deep fryer to 365°F (185 degrees C).
In a bowl, mix the flour, egg and milk.
Season with cayenne pepper, seasoning salt, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.
Mix in the conch meat, onion, red & yellow & green bell pepper, celery and garlic.
Drop the batter by rounded tablespoons into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
BE CAREFUL!
Remove the basket or with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Now, is the time to slightly season, again.
In a bowl, mix the ketchup, "lime" juice, mayonnaise, hot sauce, salt & pepper.
Serve dipping sauce on the side with the fritters.
Enjoy!

notes: Can substitute conch with calamari, shrimp, imitation crab meat, or lobster

recipes.title: Picante Dip
recipes.description: Creamy tomato and onion dip with cream cheese, served with tostadas.

instructions.text: Simmer the tomatoes and onions about 20 minutes. Cool and stir until it is only warm.
Add the rest of the ingredients and mix to the desired consistency for a dip.
Serve with tostadas.

recipes.title: Green Chile Dip
recipes.description: Simple sour cream dip with green chiles and garlic, served with tortilla or potato chips.

instructions.text: Mix all the ingredients.
Serve with tortilla chips or potato chips.

recipes.title: Avocado Dip
recipes.description: Guacamole-style dip with Colby cheese, green chiles, and green onions.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and chill.

recipes.title: Chile-izzas
recipes.description: Mini pizza bites with ground beef, biscuits, tomato sauce, cheese, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Brown the ground beef and drain. Salt to taste.
Separate the biscuits and roll them out into circles. Place them on a greased cookie sheet and spread tomato sauce on them.
Add a layer of meat, then chilies top with cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
Cut each circle into quarters and serve hot.

notes: Variation: Add sour cream or substitute pork sausage for the ground beef

recipes.title: Perritos Verdes (Green Chile Puppies)
recipes.description: Hot dogs wrapped with green chile strips and tortillas, deep fried until crispy.

instructions.text: Wrap the franks in strips of green chile or slice them partially through and fill the openings with green chile sauce.
Wrap tortilla strips around the franks and secure them with toothpicks.
Fry them briefly in hot deep fat until crisp.

recipes.title: Chile-Cheese Squares
recipes.description: A cheesy appetizer with layers of cheddar and green chiles topped with eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Layer the cheese and chiles in a buttered baking dish.
Pour the eggs over and dust with the paprika.
Bake for 30 minutes or until it tests done.
Cut into small squares and serve as an appetizer.

notes: Variation: Use ½ lb cheddar and ½ lb Monterey Jack cheese. Garnish with black olives and pimento.
Variation: Use whole green chiles to line a pie pan. Spread ½ lb grated cheddar over the chiles. Beat 8 eggs with 2 tbsp cream and salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Chil-E-Ums
recipes.description: Bite-sized rolls filled with bacon, onion, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Prepare the hot roll mix following the directions on the box.
Break up the bacon, chop the onion, and mix together with the green chiles.
Divide the roll mix into 48 equal parts.
Using your hands, spread out each piece and fill with ½ to ¾ teaspoon of the filling mixture.
Pinch the rolls together and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Chile-Izzos
recipes.description: Biscuit rounds topped with beef and cheese, baked until done.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown the ground beef and drain. Salt to taste.
Separate the biscuits and roll them out into circles. Place them on a greased cookie sheet and spread tomato sauce on them.
Add a layer of meat, then chile, then top with cheese.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Cut each circle into quarters and serve hot.

notes: Variation: Add sour cream or substitute pork sausage for the ground beef.

recipes.title: Perritos Verdes (Green Chile Puppies)
recipes.description: Hot dogs wrapped in green chile strips and tortillas, then deep-fried.

ingredients.prep_note: cooked, or 1 lb cut into 1.5-inch strips

instructions.text: Wrap the franks in strips of green chile or slice them partially through and fill the openings with green chile sauce.
Wrap tortilla strips around the franks and secure them with toothpicks.
Fry them briefly in hot deep fat until crisp.

recipes.title: Chile-Mushroom Fritters
recipes.description: Crispy fried fritters with mushrooms and green chiles.

instructions.text: In mixing bowl, combine biscuit mix, mushrooms, onion, chile, salt and celery seed.
Mix together egg yolk and sour cream; stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Beat egg white to stiff peaks. Gently fold beaten egg white into mushroom mixture.
In heavy saucepan or electric deep-fat fryer, heat oil to 375 degrees.
Drop batter by tablespoonfuls into hot oil. Fry about 2 minutes or until golden brown, turning once. Transfer to rack to drain.

recipes.title: Pecorino with Honey and Walnuts
recipes.description: A simple Italian appetizer pairing sharp Pecorino with sweet honey and crunchy walnuts.

instructions.text: Arrange Pecorino wedges on a serving board.
Scatter toasted walnuts around the cheese.
Drizzle honey generously over the cheese.
Add pear slices if using.
Serve with crusty bread or crackers.

notes: Use aged Pecorino Toscano for a milder flavor or Pecorino Romano for sharper taste
Pairs beautifully with a robust red wine

recipes.title: Manchego with Membrillo (Quince Paste)
recipes.description: The classic Spanish pairing of nutty Manchego cheese with sweet quince paste. Simple perfection.

instructions.text: Arrange Manchego slices on a serving board.
Place membrillo slices alongside the cheese.
Scatter Marcona almonds around the board.
Serve with crusty bread. Instruct guests to pair a piece of cheese with membrillo in each bite.

notes: True Manchego is made only from Manchega sheep milk in La Mancha, Spain
Look for Denominación de Origen label for authentic Manchego

recipes.title: Manchego Croquetas
recipes.description: Crispy fried croquettes filled with creamy béchamel and Manchego cheese. A beloved Spanish bar snack.

instructions.text: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook 2 minutes.
Gradually whisk in warm milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until very thick, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in Manchego, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until cheese melts.
Spread mixture in a baking dish. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Shape cold mixture into small cylinders or ovals using wet hands.
Dip each croqueta in beaten egg, then coat in breadcrumbs. Double-coat for extra crunch.
Heat 2 inches of oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry croquetas in batches until golden, about 2-3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

notes: Can add jamón serrano to the béchamel
Croquetas can be frozen before frying

recipes.title: Endive Boats with Roquefort and Pear
recipes.description: Crisp endive leaves filled with Roquefort, pear, and walnuts. An elegant appetizer.

instructions.text: Blend Roquefort and cream cheese until smooth.
Fold in half the diced pear and half the walnuts.
Spoon or pipe mixture into endive leaves.
Top each with remaining pear, walnuts, and a drizzle of honey.
Garnish with snipped chives.
Arrange on platter and serve immediately.

notes: Can substitute radicchio cups if endive unavailable
Prepare filling ahead, assemble just before serving

recipes.title: Classic Swiss Cheese Fondue
recipes.description: Traditional Swiss fondue with Gruyère and Emmental, white wine, and kirsch. Perfect for sharing.

instructions.text: Rub fondue pot with cut garlic. Discard garlic.
Add wine and lemon juice. Heat over medium until simmering.
Toss cheeses with cornstarch.
Add cheese by handfuls, stirring constantly in a figure-8 motion.
Wait for each addition to melt before adding more.
Once smooth, stir in kirsch, nutmeg, and pepper.
Transfer to fondue pot over low flame.
Serve with bread cubes for dipping. Stir occasionally.

notes: If fondue gets too thick, add a splash of warm wine
Also great with apple slices, vegetables, or small potatoes

recipes.title: Baked Brie with Honey and Nuts
recipes.description: Warm, gooey brie topped with honey, walnuts, and fresh rosemary. An irresistible appetizer.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Place brie on a small baking dish or oven-safe plate.
Score the top rind in a crosshatch pattern (optional - helps cheese ooze).
Bake 12-15 minutes until soft and gooey inside.
Drizzle with honey and top with nuts and rosemary.
Sprinkle with flaky salt.
Serve immediately with crackers or bread.

notes: Don't overbake or cheese will run everywhere
Can add fig jam or dried cranberries

recipes.title: Brie en Croûte
recipes.description: Brie wrapped in golden puff pastry with a layer of jam. Impressive yet easy.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line baking sheet with parchment.
Roll puff pastry slightly larger if needed.
Spread jam on top of brie.
Place brie jam-side down in center of pastry.
Fold pastry up and over brie, pleating to enclose. Trim excess.
Flip seam-side down onto baking sheet.
Brush with egg wash. Score decorative pattern if desired.
Bake 20-25 minutes until pastry is deep golden.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Letting it rest prevents cheese from running out when cut
Can add prosciutto or dried fruit inside

recipes.title: Labneh Dip with Za'atar and Olive Oil
recipes.description: Creamy strained yogurt cheese drizzled with olive oil and za'atar. Essential Middle Eastern mezze.

instructions.text: Spread labneh on a plate or shallow bowl, creating a well in the center.
Pool olive oil in the well.
Sprinkle generously with za'atar.
Add mint and pine nuts if using.
Finish with Aleppo pepper.
Serve with warm pita for scooping.

notes: Za'atar is a blend of thyme, sumac, and sesame - essential for this dish
Can shape labneh into balls and roll in za'atar for a different presentation

recipes.title: Classic Provoleta Argentina
recipes.source_note: Traditional Argentine grilled cheese, created by Italian immigrants in 1940s Buenos Aires
recipes.description: Grilled provolone cheese with oregano and red pepper flakes, the essential opening act of an Argentine asado.

instructions.text: Let cheese come to room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour before cooking. This helps form a better crust.
Lightly coat a cast iron skillet with olive oil and place over medium-high heat (375-400°F) on grill or stovetop.
When skillet is hot, place the cheese wheel in the pan.
Sprinkle oregano and red pepper flakes over the top of the cheese.
Cover and cook for about 5 minutes until cheese is fully melted, bubbly, and edges are golden brown and crispy.
Carefully remove from heat and serve immediately with toasted bread for dipping.

notes: Use a cast iron skillet to prevent cheese from melting through grill grates
Best enjoyed immediately while hot and gooey
For indoor cooking, finish under broiler for golden crust

recipes.title: Provoleta with Chimichurri
recipes.source_note: Provoleta served with traditional chimichurri sauce
recipes.description: Grilled provolone topped with fresh, herbaceous chimichurri sauce for a burst of Argentine flavor.

instructions.text: Make chimichurri: Combine parsley, oregano, garlic, red pepper flakes, and both vinegars in a mortar and pestle or food processor. Work into a thick paste.
Add salt and olive oil, mixing until you have a thick, chunky sauce. Set aside.
Set up grill for two-zone cooking with one side at high heat.
Preheat a cast iron skillet over high heat, then move to indirect heat zone.
Place cold cheese directly over high heat for 2 minutes to brown the bottom.
Transfer cheese to the hot skillet and cover until melted and bubbly, 2-3 minutes.
Meanwhile, brush baguette slices with oil and grill until charred, about 1 minute per side.
Top hot melted cheese with a generous dollop of chimichurri and serve with grilled bread.

notes: Chimichurri can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 1 week
Hand-chopping herbs gives better texture than food processor
Chimichurri should be loose and chunky, not paste-like

recipes.title: Provoleta with Salsa Criolla
recipes.attribution: Argentine grilled cheese with fresh vegetable relish
recipes.source_note: Provoleta served with traditional salsa criolla
recipes.description: Grilled provolone served with salsa criolla, a zesty relish of fresh tomatoes, peppers, and onions.

instructions.text: Make salsa criolla: Combine olive oil, vinegar, parsley, garlic, bell pepper, onion, and tomato in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 425°F with rack in upper third.
Heat 1 tsp oil in a cast iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Add provolone and sprinkle half the oregano and pepper flakes on top.
Cook, flipping once, until cheese bubbles and edges brown, 4-6 minutes total.
Transfer to oven and bake until melted and golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Top with remaining oregano and pepper flakes.
Serve immediately with salsa criolla and sliced baguette.

notes: Salsa criolla can be made up to 4 hours ahead
The relish should be fresh and crunchy, not cooked
Let cheese come to room temperature before cooking for best crust

recipes.title: Sardo Cheese Crostini with Sun-Dried Tomatoes
recipes.source_note: Toasted bread topped with Argentine grating cheese and sun-dried tomatoes
recipes.description: Crispy crostini topped with sharp Sardo cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and fresh herbs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange baguette slices on a baking sheet. Brush lightly with olive oil.
Bake until golden and crisp, 5-6 minutes.
While still warm, rub each slice with the cut side of garlic clove.
Top each crostini with sun-dried tomato slices.
Sprinkle generously with grated Sardo cheese.
Return to oven for 2 minutes until cheese is slightly melted.
Top with fresh basil leaf and crack of black pepper. Serve warm.

notes: Sardo's sharp, salty flavor pairs perfectly with sweet sun-dried tomatoes
Can substitute fresh tomatoes in summer
Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction for extra flavor

recipes.title: Picada Argentina with Magnasco Edam
recipes.source_note: Argentine snack board featuring the country's distinctive Edam cheese
recipes.description: A traditional Argentine snack platter featuring Magnasco Edam alongside cured meats, olives, and accompaniments.

instructions.text: Select a large wooden board or platter for presentation.
Arrange cubed or sliced Magnasco Edam cheese in the center of the board.
Fan salami and ham slices on one side of the cheese.
Place olives in small bowls or pile directly on the board.
Scatter nuts around the board.
Add bread slices and breadsticks along the edges.
Place small dishes of mayonnaise and mustard for dipping.
If using quince paste, cut into small squares and arrange near the cheese.
Serve with red wine at room temperature for the traditional experience.

notes: Picada comes from the verb 'picar' meaning to pick at or nibble
Magnasco Edam is dryer and harder than Dutch Edam, perfect for slicing
This is Argentina's answer to charcuterie boards, enjoyed before asado or with evening wine

recipes.title: Magnasco Edam with Wine and Crackers
recipes.source_note: Simple presentation of Argentina's distinctive Edam cheese
recipes.description: Argentine Magnasco Edam served simply with crackers and paired with robust red wine.

instructions.text: Remove Magnasco Edam from refrigerator 30 minutes before serving to bring to room temperature.
Cut a wedge from the Edam ball to reveal the interior. Alternatively, cut into cubes or thin slices.
Arrange crackers in a fan pattern on a serving board.
Place cheese wedge or cubes in the center.
Add grapes, dried apricots, and walnuts around the cheese.
Open red wine and let it breathe for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve cheese at room temperature with wine.

notes: Magnasco is Argentina's oldest dairy, founded by Italian immigrants 155 years ago
Argentine Edam is sharper and harder than Dutch Edam
The red wax coating is traditional and beautiful for presentation
Pairs excellently with Argentine Malbec

recipes.title: Divine Baked Feta
recipes.description: Simple baked feta with olive oil, crushed red pepper, and oregano. Surprisingly mild despite the heat.

ingredients.item: bread rounds or crackers for serving

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F.
Slice feta and arrange in an oven-safe dish.
Drizzle generously with olive oil.
Sprinkle heavily with crushed red pepper (seeds and all).
Add crushed oregano (dried is fine, but not powdered).
Grind fresh black pepper over the top.
Bake for 10 minutes until feta is soft and warm.
Serve immediately with bread rounds or crackers.

notes: Feta's saltiness balances the pepper heat
Use crushed dried oregano, not powdered
Serve immediately while warm and soft

recipes.title: Israeli-Style Hummus
recipes.description: Authentic smooth hummus made from scratch with dried chickpeas. Served warm with olive oil.

instructions.text: Soak chickpeas overnight in cold water with 1 tbsp baking soda (speeds cooking).
Drain and rinse well. Place in pressure cooker covered by 2 inches water.
Bring to boil, skim foam, then cook 1-1.5 hours until beans are 'soft as butter'.
CRITICAL: Never add salt during cooking - beans won't soften.
Separate cooked beans from liquid, reserving both.
Pass beans through sieve to remove skins for smoothest texture.
While still warm: add half the lemon juice, 3-4 tbsp hot cooking water, minced garlic, tahini, and salt.
Mix thoroughly. Taste and adjust lemon, salt, and consistency.
Serve warm in bowls topped with whole chickpeas, cooking liquid, generous olive oil, and paprika.
Serve with fresh pita bread.

notes: Baking soda in soaking water dramatically speeds cooking
Never salt until after cooking - prevents softening
Removing skins creates silkiest texture
Serve warm for authentic Israeli style

recipes.title: Maltese Pastizzi (Cheese Pies)
recipes.description: Traditional Maltese savory pastries filled with ricotta-style cheese and herbs in flaky puff pastry.

ingredients.item: fresh basil or herbs of choice

instructions.text: Preheat oven according to puff pastry package directions (usually 400°F).
Mix cheese, egg, and herbs thoroughly. Drain any excess whey.
Roll puff pastry thinner than usual.
Cut each sheet into 9 equal squares.
Place 1 tsp cheese mixture in center of each square.
Fold two opposite corners over the filling.
Twist remaining two corners like a candy wrapper.
Trim excess pastry from twisted ends.
Place on parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake until golden brown, about 15-20 minutes.

notes: Can be frozen before baking
