Thaw before baking or add a few extra minutes
Traditional Maltese cheese can be substituted with ricotta
Serve with marinara or preferred dipping sauce

recipes.title: Feta and Pumpkin Pastries
recipes.description: Flaky filo triangles filled with roasted butternut pumpkin and tangy feta cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place pumpkin cubes on baking tray. Crush garlic over top.
Drizzle with herb oil, season with salt and pepper.
Roast until pumpkin is soft, about 25-30 minutes.
Transfer roasted pumpkin to bowl. Add feta.
Mash together with potato masher. Adjust seasoning.
Layer two filo sheets together, brush with melted butter.
Cut lengthwise into 3 strips.
Place spoonful of filling at bottom of each strip.
Fold diagonally up the strip to form triangles.
Brush tops with butter.
Bake about 15-20 minutes until golden brown.

notes: Don't overfill or they may burst open
Can be frozen before baking
Serve with dipping sauce of choice
Butternut can be substituted with other squash

recipes.title: Hillbilly Fondue
recipes.description: A simple Swiss and Gruyere cheese fondue made in a double boiler. Perfect for dipping French bread.

instructions.text: Set up a double boiler (one pot nested in another containing hot water).
Rub the inside of the top pot with garlic. Discard the garlic clove(s).
Combine cornstarch with the grated cheeses.
Simmer the wine in the top pot of your double boiler. Heat should be at medium or less.
Add Swiss cheese and Gruyere cheese a bit at a time making sure the cheese is melted before adding more. Stir constantly.
Add nutmeg if desired.
Place the pot on a hotplate set to low heat to maintain the fondue's melting consistency.
Spear bread pieces on a fork and dip into the fondue.

notes: Double quantities for 4 servings
Any cheese that melts easily works well

recipes.title: Harvest Chicken Liver Pâté
recipes.description: A rich and flavorful chicken liver pâté with apple, bourbon, and warm spices. Perfect for entertaining.

ingredients.item: large tart apple, peeled, cored and chopped

instructions.text: Clean livers by removing fibrous bits and dark spots, rinse well, and soak in milk for 24 hours (optional but recommended). Drain, rinse, and pat dry.
Sauté bacon in butter until crispy. Add onion, celery, and garlic. Sauté until tender.
Add apple and livers, cooking until livers are firm but pink inside and apple softens. Add sage, allspice, and nutmeg, cooking one minute more.
Transfer to bowl. Deglaze pan with bourbon, reducing to 3 tablespoons, then transfer to bowl with seasonings and cream if desired.
Purée with stick blender until smooth.
Pack into ramekins and top with clarified butter.
Refrigerate overnight or up to 10 days.

notes: Soaking livers in milk removes bitterness
Serve with sliced baguette, crackers or mini toasts

recipes.title: Deep Fried Cheese Curds
recipes.description: Classic Wisconsin-style fried cheese curds with a light, crispy batter. A state fair favorite.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Stir in the eggs and milk. Mix until smooth. Add more milk for a thinner batter.
Coat the cheese curds with the batter.
Heat the oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat to 375°F.
Fry the coated cheese curds approximately 1 minute each, until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

notes: Freezing curds before breading prevents cheese from liquefying
Serve immediately while hot and gooey
Fresh curds that squeak are best

recipes.title: Tyropites (Greek Cheese Pies)
recipes.source_note: CheeseForum.org - Favorite Recipes (reconstructed from traditional recipe)
recipes.description: Flaky phyllo triangles filled with a mixture of feta and ricotta cheese. A beloved Greek appetizer or snack.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, mix feta, ricotta, eggs, dill (if using), and pepper until well combined.
Unroll phyllo and cover with a damp towel to prevent drying.
Take one sheet of phyllo, brush lightly with melted butter, and fold in half lengthwise.
Brush the folded strip with more butter.
Place a heaping tablespoon of filling at one end of the strip.
Fold the corner over the filling to form a triangle, then continue folding (like folding a flag) to the end of the strip.
Brush the outside with butter and place seam-side down on the baking sheet.
Repeat with remaining phyllo and filling.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
Let cool slightly before serving (filling will be very hot).

notes: Can be frozen unbaked - bake from frozen adding 5-10 minutes
Similar to spanakopita but without spinach
Some versions add a pinch of nutmeg

flags: Recipe reconstructed from forum discussion of traditional method

recipes.title: Baked Ricotta
recipes.description: A simple, elegant appetizer of creamy baked ricotta served with crusty bread.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
If ricotta is very wet, drain in cheesecloth for 30 minutes.
Mix ricotta with 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic, herbs, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
Transfer to a small oven-safe dish. Smooth top.
Drizzle remaining olive oil over top.
Bake 40-45 minutes until golden on top.
Let rest 5 minutes. Drizzle with more olive oil.
Serve warm with sliced crusty bread.

notes: Top with cherry tomatoes before baking for variation
Best with homemade ricotta

recipes.title: Lemony Baked Ricotta with Herbs
recipes.description: A delicious appetizer of warm ricotta baked with lemon zest and herbs until bubbly and slightly browned. Perfect served with toasted baguette slices.

ingredients.item: dried herbs (Italian blend or herbs de Provence)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix lemon zest into warm ricotta.
Add 1 teaspoon dried herbs and sea salt to taste; stir to combine.
Coat an oven-proof skillet with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Spoon ricotta mixture into the skillet.
Drizzle with additional olive oil and sprinkle remaining herbs on top.
Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes until bubbly and slightly browned.
Serve warm with lightly toasted baguette slices.

notes: Can use store-bought or homemade ricotta
Best served immediately while warm and bubbly
Try different herb combinations based on preference

recipes.title: Greek Layer Dip
recipes.source_note: The Art of Cheese - theartofcheese.com (June Small, The Small Farm)
recipes.description: A Mediterranean-inspired layered dip with hummus, pesto, artichokes, fresh vegetables, olives, and crumbled feta. Perfect for parties.

instructions.text: Spread hummus evenly across the bottom of a serving dish.
Layer pesto over the hummus.
Scatter chopped marinated artichokes over pesto.
Add layer of finely chopped cucumber.
Add layer of finely chopped grape tomatoes.
Scatter coarsely chopped olives on top.
Top with crumbled feta cheese.
For best flavor, chill in refrigerator for a couple of hours before serving.
Serve with pita chips.

notes: Can use homemade feta for even better flavor
Marinated feta adds extra flavor dimension
Layers can be adjusted based on preference

recipes.title: Pork Dumplings
recipes.description: Pork and chive dumplings with black vinegar dipping sauce

instructions.text: Mix flour and salt, gradually add water while stirring. Knead until smooth, rest 1 hour.
Combine pork with mushrooms, garlic, ginger, chives, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
Roll dough into thin wrappers about 3.5 inches in diameter.
Fill each wrapper with 1 tbsp filling, fold and pleat edges to seal.
Pan-fry dumplings in oil, add water, cover and steam 5-7 minutes.
Remove lid, crisp bottoms 1-2 minutes. Serve with black vinegar dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Baked Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Crispy baked chicken wings with hot sauce glaze

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Pat wings dry, season with garlic powder, paprika, and salt.
Heat oil and butter in oven-safe pan. Brown wings on both sides.
Transfer to oven, bake 15 minutes until cooked to 165°F.
Toss with hot sauce and additional butter. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chilli Beef Lettuce Wraps
recipes.description: Spicy beef and pork mince in crisp lettuce cups

instructions.text: Brown mixed mince in oil until crispy. Drain excess fat.
Add garlic, ginger, and chillies with sesame oil. Cook 2 minutes.
Add sugar and fish sauce. Stir in lime zest, juice, and spring onions.
Make dressing with soy, lime, sesame oil, chilli, coriander, fish sauce, and sugar.
Spoon mince into lettuce cups, drizzle with dressing and serve.
